{
    "number": 287312,
    "data": "11,31,41,61,71,739,821,1231,1559,1723,2297,2543,2707,2789,2953,3527,3691,4019,5003,5167,5413,5659,5741,5987,6151,6397,65701,66431,67891,72271,76651,81031,81761,83221,85411,100741,102931,108041,121181,135781,136511,140891",
    "name": "Primes that can be generated by the concatenation in base 9, in ascending order, of two consecutive integers read in base 10.",
    "example": [
        "1 and 2 in base 9 are 1 and 2 and concat(1,2) = 12 in base 10 is 11;",
        "9 and 10 in base 9 are 10 and 11 and concat(10,11) = 1011 in base 10 is 739."
    ],
    "maple": [
        "with(numtheory): P:= proc(q,h) local a,b,c,d,k,n; a:=convert(q+1,base,h); b:=convert(q,base,h); c:=[op(a),op(b)]; d:=0; for k from nops(c) by -1 to 1 do d:=h*d+c[k]; od; if isprime(d) then d; fi; end: seq(P(i,9),i=1..1000);"
    ],
    "mathematica": [
        "With[{b = 9}, Select[Map[FromDigits[Flatten@ IntegerDigits[#, b], b] &, Partition[Range@ 200, 2, 1]], PrimeQ]] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, May 25 2017 *)"
    ],
    "xref": [
        "Cf. A000040, A030458."
    ],
    "keyword": "nonn,base,easy",
    "offset": "1,1",
    "author": "_Paolo P. Lava_, May 24 2017",
    "references": 0,
    "revision": 6,
    "time": "2017-05-28T09:35:26-04:00",
    "created": "2017-05-28T09:35:26-04:00"
}
